current_medications.description: List all medications you are currently taking

allergies.description: List any known allergies (medications, food, environmental)

current_symptoms.description: Describe any symptoms you are currently experiencing

respiratory_symptoms.shortness_of_breath: Severe and progressive. Occurs with minimal exertion such as walking to bathroom. Requires supplemental oxygen continuously.
respiratory_symptoms.coughing: Chronic dry, non-productive cough throughout the day. Particularly bothersome at night.
respiratory_symptoms.chest_tightness: Moderate chest tightness, constant dull ache
respiratory_symptoms.sputum_production: Minimal, occasionally small amounts of clear mucus

general_symptoms.fatigue: Severe fatigue, exhausted by simple activities. Requires frequent rest periods.
general_symptoms.weight_changes: Lost 15 lbs over past year despite trying to maintain weight
general_symptoms.sleep_quality: Very poor - wakes every 2-3 hours due to coughing and dyspnea

pain_assessment.description: Rate your pain levels and describe location

chest_pain.triggers: Deep breathing, coughing fits, physical activity

other_pain.description: Discomfort in fingertips, noticed increased clubbing

functional_status.description: Rate your ability to perform daily activities
functional_status.walking_distance: Limited to 20-30 feet before severe dyspnea, uses walker with oxygen
functional_status.stair_climbing: Unable to climb stairs without extreme difficulty
functional_status.self_care_activities: Requires assistance with bathing, dressing. Wife helps with most activities.
functional_status.work_status: Fully retired, former engineer. Unable to work for past 3 years.
functional_status.exercise_tolerance: Minimal - participates in seated exercises only

quality_of_life.description: Rate how your condition affects your daily life
quality_of_life.physical_limitations: Extreme limitations - mostly homebound, cannot perform basic tasks without assistance
quality_of_life.emotional_wellbeing: Moderate to severe depression. Sees therapist monthly. Anxious about disease progression.
quality_of_life.social_activities: Very isolated - rarely sees friends or family outside of immediate household
quality_of_life.sleep_quality: Poor - requires sleeping in recliner, cannot lie flat

environmental_exposures.description: Note any environmental factors affecting your health
environmental_exposures.occupational_exposures: Worked as industrial engineer for 35 years. Exposure to metal dust, silica, and various chemicals. Potential asbestos exposure at job sites in 1980s-1990s.
environmental_exposures.home_environment: Single-level home, recently modified with ramps. Air filtration system installed. Wife removed all carpeting.
environmental_exposures.air_quality_concerns: Extremely sensitive to air quality. Cannot go outside on poor air quality days.
environmental_exposures.recent_travel: Unable to travel due to oxygen requirements and disease severity

compliance.description: How well are you following your treatment plan
compliance.medication_adherence: 95% compliant - uses pill organizer and medication tracking app
compliance.oxygen_usage: Continuous oxygen at 4-5 L/min via concentrator, 24/7 use. Increases to 6 L/min with any activity.
compliance.pulmonary_rehabilitation: Unable to attend due to severity of disease. Home health PT visits twice weekly.
compliance.dietary_restrictions: Following high-calorie, high-protein diet to prevent further weight loss. Small frequent meals due to early satiety.

recent_hospitalizations.treatment: High-flow oxygen, antibiotics for suspected infection

recent_procedures.result: Progressive interstitial changes, increased honeycombing in bilateral lower lobes
FVC 52% predicted, DLCO 38% predicted - severe restrictive pattern
Unable to complete - severe desaturation to 78% after 50 feet

upcoming_appointments.purpose: Discuss disease progression and treatment options
Weekly oxygen monitoring and medication review

additional_notes.patient_concerns: Very concerned about rapid disease progression. Fearful of suffocation. Worried about being a burden on family. Interested in lung transplant but concerned about age and complications. Has completed advance directive.
additional_notes.goals_for_visit: Understand prognosis, discuss palliative care options, review transplant eligibility, optimize symptom management
